number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												One of my favorite free to play titles!Do you enjoy class based shooters like Team Fortress 2 or Tribes Ascend? Do you enjoy MOBAs such as DOTA 2 or Smite etc? If you you said yes to either or both of those questions you owe it to yourself to give this game a shot. Right when you start they have an optional tutorial level where you can test out hero abilities, learn about the different AI controlled enemies (called creeps usually, bots in this case), and get a feel for the environmental weapons and events to help ease you into this hybrid style of game. Naturally a veteran of any of the previously mentioned games will want to skip over this, but you can leave the tutorial from the menu anytime so I recommend checking it out at least for the environment attacks.There is also a co-op horde mode which can be used for increased training before the real deal or as an alternative to regular matchmaking should you find high wait times* or have a more PvE minded team. It lacks the strategy of defending towers or spawning creeps, but is a good way to practice shooting, coordinating team abilities, or having absent minded fun. *Wait times are currently ridiculous in the 5v5 modes due to low player countSuper Crossfire is the name of the game's main entree. You only have two lanes and one jungle so team fights happen often and are never far away from you. One lane usually has 2 people and the other has 3, causing one of the lanes to be constantly pushed and therefore in need of defending. Alternatively you can have a fifth man roam between the lanes seeking the enemy roamer or hiding for surprise attacks. In the middle of all the fighting and pushing, events are constantly occurring in the jungle like a free money spawning "enemy", a Roshan like boss that gives a buff on defeat, a creep wiping laser and more. This gives the game a perpetual feeling of motion and speed never allowing boredom.There is another game mode which takes the premise of Super Crossfire and makes it more shooter-esque. Damage is increased, speed is increased, turret shields do NOT come back, health regen changes from DOTA-like to Halo-like, and other changes to creeps and players. This mode is great if you want a faster match or are less fond of the strategy layer.In Short:PROS+ Great Hero Variety+ Multiple Maps+ Multiple Modes+ Map Events+ Perfect Balance of Action and Strategy+ Excellent Humor with Top-Notch Voice Acting+ Amazing Art Style and GraphicsCONS- Long Matchmaking/No playerbase - game abandoned by devs. (The developers would like to revive it though)- What's left of the players are the most toxic of the community- No new content planned (heroes, maps, etc.) again due to abandonment- Matchmaking isn't separated by skill so new players can get destroyed by long time playersIf you can get 4 friends to try it with you a great game is waiting to be discovered even if you stick to the horde mode. If you can find 9 friends you've eliminated virtually all of the cons to this game.9.5/10

content:
Posted: February 16, 2012
												Anti-recommendation.This game is completely inaccessable for new players in any way, shape or form. The player base is primarily composed of hardcore players that spent hundreds of thousands of hours playing Monday Night Combat, as well as people that spend too much time playing MOBAs as well.Essentially you have a toxic envoirment for any new players; no one will "teach" you how to play and expect you to know how everything works from the get-go. The mechanics and even the controls aren't explained to you - I had to be told at least THREE DEGREES from friends that knew how to play that there was even a button to assign skill points!Just as well, there is no tutorial system whatsoever, there isn't a balance between setting players up that have barely started playing versus those who have hundreds of games under their belts, and all in all they seek to make the game less fun for newbies like me.If this gets out of beta safely it will be a marvel.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												NOTE: Game currently has little players and some of them are just cheating... Who ♥♥♥♥ing cheats in an almost dead game? Jeez, some people... Get a life.Best MOBA ever. The objective of the game is to push your bots (minions) to the opposing team's base center (called "moneyball"), by destroying their defensive turrets (note that only bots can remove the turrets' shield). Only the bots can bring down the moneyball so you can shoot it. Killing the opposing players is good, but keep in mind it is not the objective of the game. I've seen teams with a lot of kills lose the game because they forgot to push their bots. This is not CoD ;)This game is so fun and underrrated I could cry. Since I discovered it I cannot stop playing it. It has a good dose of humour, gameplay is very good, player base is hilarious (don't take anyone too seriously), balanced matches are very intense. Game relies a lot on teamplay, although very good players can tip the balance. Sadly too few players, but usually you can find turbocross matches, although these matches can be a little too harsh for newbies sometimes, as usual players are already somewhat experienced.Some bugs appear from time to time, but nothing really annoying. Cheaters sometimes appear to ruin the match. These sad little kids with no life or skill have nothing better to do than cheat in an almost dead game. They think they're so 1337 because they can cheat. My main strategy in these cases is just leaving the match, not worth your anger. But don't confuse good players with cheaters ;)Shame on Ubersoft for not caring about this game anymore. PS: if you're new please don't pick assassin, it's not a good class for beginners. Good players♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥you with assassin doesn't mean you can play her as well as they do. And btw cloaking is NOT invisibility.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2016
Name: Super Monday Night CombatVariations: Super MNCDeveloper: Uber EntertainmentDate: 2012Relationships: Sequel To "Monday Night Combat" (2010)Genre: MOBA, TPSOrientation: MultiplayerPopulation: Few Who SurvivedPerspective: 3D - Third-PersonTimeflow: Match-Based, Real-TimeSkills: FingersSetting: FuturisticStyle: -Tags: Complicated, No Campaign, No Story, No Tutorial, Noob Unfriendly, RPG ElementsModel: F2PContent: MicrotransactionsPlatforms: PCReview: Futuristic TPS MOBA game with complicated rules and few game modes, including typical lanes-towers-nexus-5v5, defend-nexus-from-waves and something else I couldn't try. Why? Simply no players, miss Queue is just lost and doesn't know what is she supposed to do with these 10 people online. All games are created as custom games with no exceptions, and invitations are sent through chat.	There is no tutorial, just bulsh*t youtube video that says 3 words about each thing in the game, leaving you wondering about 80% things. That's how developers respect new players. Not even all controls are explained (and you can not change controls as far as I know - I played few training games and 1 multiplayer before someone finally explained me how to switch weapons, Jesus.	Rules are so complex that after watching this 7 minute video you still won't know anything. Go to Practice mode, and spend good 30 minutes running around the map clicking on green rays (about 20 of them if not more) - then tutorial voice will tell you information about different things in game. But still, even if you manage to remember all this sh*t, don't expect knowing everything about the game.	There are hero classes (heroes are called 'pros' here), minion types each with weaknesses and advantages, turret types, level ups and abilities (usable or toggle), different jungle mobs, super-powa self-buff, different vendor machines on map selling stats and buffs, purchasable jump pads, deploying minions, map objectives like 'annihilator' that destroys all enemies when used, items providing unique bonuses and more - I don't remember everything honestly.	Visually game looks nice - futuristic cityscape arenas in sport style, minions looking like droids of different shapes and sizes, and characters looking slightly close to Team Fortress 2 guys but less comic. And of course cosmetic things you can buy make it even more beautiful. But.. there is no point doing so. Game is so dead you can't even try it.	I never tried original B2P Monday Night Combat, but I'm afraid that if Super MNC is so dead than orinal is nothing but a ghost town...Class: III - Dead BreadVerdict: NoReviewed: 1.11.2016Approach: Steam - PCTime: An HourDeeds:  1 Multiplayer Match Played (Don't laugh great achievement in such conditions)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
												There's a reason I only played ten hours. Most people that I knew got turned off after one and a half. Broken matchmaking systems, the lack of dev support, waiting for literally up to ONE AND A HALF HOURS or so for either L0Z0rThaP3ngu1nofDOOM, xXxDeath_MasterxXx, or juan.santos2005 to join in, the fact that the top guide nowadays is made specifically to get people in and out as fast as possible, and the fact that the majority of the 40 people still playing this game have turned into a toxic mess rivaling low tier competitive LoL or DOTA just makes it a awful game to be on. The hat's you get from this game for TF2 look bad, and the cosmetics you get in this game are overpriced to oblivion AND look bad. If the Mann Co. Store from TF2 and EA's cosmetic DLC system had a baby, it would be the Uber store, which currently in a eternal sale because of how little it's been used. If you like old memes and wasting cash, look no further.Along with ugly costumes, it has honestly one of the worst class buying systems out there. Heroes of the Storm got nothing on this. Basic characters, like stronger tanks or longer range characters, have to be unlocked with hard earned THOUSANDS of coins (The TANK class, for example, needs 4500 coins). You only get like 40 coins per win/loss. This is a problem, and often leads to new players get destroyed by older, richer, and more class unlocked players.	On the bright side of this mess, the combat's in SMNC is alright. With the 5 classes you get unlocked, out of the game's unlockable 17, being fun to use when you finally do good (rarely), and offer different playstyles which spices up the game a bit. Blitz is pretty cool as well, a Tower Defense sort of deal against the robots that gives lots of XP on completion. Use this if your grinding for that last TF2 hat, you're going to need that last boost after spending time during the dead hours of the game.In short, with a tiny community practically rivaling DOTA/LoL levels of toxicity, overpriced and ugly cosmetics and hero unlocks, ridiculous grinding for ugly rewards, and a horrendous amount of waiting, even for a dead game, the combat and game modes can't save this from not getting a recommendation.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
												There's a reason I only played ten hours. Most people that I knew got turned off after one and a half. Broken matchmaking systems, the lack of dev support, waiting for literally up to ONE AND A HALF HOURS or so for either L0Z0rThaP3ngu1nofDOOM, xXxDeath_MasterxXx, or juan.santos2005 to join in, the fact that the top guide nowadays is made specifically to get people in and out as fast as possible, and the fact that the majority of the 40 people still playing this game have turned into a toxic mess rivaling low tier competitive LoL or DOTA just makes it a awful game to be on. The hat's you get from this game for TF2 look bad, and the cosmetics you get in this game are overpriced to oblivion AND look bad. If the Mann Co. Store from TF2 and EA's cosmetic DLC system had a baby, it would be the Uber store, which currently in a eternal sale because of how little it's been used. If you like old memes and wasting cash, look no further.Along with ugly costumes, it has honestly one of the worst class buying systems out there. Heroes of the Storm got nothing on this. Basic characters, like stronger tanks or longer range characters, have to be unlocked with hard earned THOUSANDS of coins (The TANK class, for example, needs 4500 coins). You only get like 40 coins per win/loss. This is a problem, and often leads to new players get destroyed by older, richer, and more class unlocked players.	On the bright side of this mess, the combat's in SMNC is alright. With the 5 classes you get unlocked, out of the game's unlockable 17, being fun to use when you finally do good (rarely), and offer different playstyles which spices up the game a bit. Blitz is pretty cool as well, a Tower Defense sort of deal against the robots that gives lots of XP on completion. Use this if your grinding for that last TF2 hat, you're going to need that last boost after spending time during the dead hours of the game.In short, with a tiny community practically rivaling DOTA/LoL levels of toxicity, overpriced and ugly cosmetics and hero unlocks, ridiculous grinding for ugly rewards, and a horrendous amount of waiting, even for a dead game, the combat and game modes can't save this from not getting a recommendation.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
												After playing monday night combat on xbox as one of their indie games i fell in love with this game. The characters and the concept of it were just perfect and i coudlnt wait till this F2p second coming was gonna be on steam.But, sadly it just didnt get the players it needed. People right outa beta just crub stompd the poo outa the newer players and i think i left people to not wanting to come back. Sadly you couldnt fix it though, at its peak it only had around 3-4k players i think? (maybe a lil more?). You cant exactly make skill based match making with so few people imo.Then they started adding different game modes which was the beginning of the end for this game. You cant add 2 diff game modes and expect it to not cripple your player base by taking a small community and then spreading it out even more.Finally the last straw for me was when they decided to just jump ship and start on PA, completely dogging anyone who put any money into this game (i didnt spend money but boy did they get plenty of my time). They said (UBER ENT) that they wouldnt just leave this game while working on PA, they could do both. Well 2 months after they said that they gave some swan song forum post about how all their resources need to be on PA and they will go back to super monday night combat when PA is in a good place. Now im pretty sure this games about dead with prolly like 100 people playing if youre lucky (maybe 2-300), they are liars, would love for them to prove me wrong, but why would they come back to a dieing game. I bought a computer JUST to play this game, thats how much i loved it. But UBER said FU community, we got your cash, off to the next ponzi scheme/half finished game with a premium shop. For this they get a big fat NO. Not because the games not fun, but because these goofs dont deserve a good review or anyone elses money. Anything theyve made is dead. Let that be your guide into wether or not you should consider planetary annialation.... UberEnt - money grabbin like its hot since 2008

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
												This is game is mostly dead, just to let any of you who might be interested in it-know. Uber hasn't updated SMNC in about 3 years.If you are interested in obtaining the Flamingo Kid and the Triclops hats in TF2, it takes approximately 224 afk games of Custom Blitz (a mode which you can play by yourself.) Just leave your computer open and start a new match every few minutes or so, and you'll be able to get them fairly quickly.Oh, and the game itself it a mess. There are too many conflicting art styles with the characters and game; even the main menu music can range anywhere from smooth jazz to hard metal rock. Animations are very choppy and get stale after a while. I can't really comment on the gameplay (as I only played a very few matches with actual people,) but I can say that grapple spam is very prominent, and basically lets you stun-lock your foes to death if you time it right.3/10 Overall. So much potential, it's a shame the developers let the game go so easily. Would only recommend this game for the free hats.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												The only reason anyone in their right mind would play this game is because of the tf2 hats you get. I only played one game, and I think I'll die before I get the level 20 hat. Oh well. Basically, I have no fun playing it, and it takes 10 minutes to find a match. And when you are in game, you realize how lazy the developer is. The game looks like a bad copy of loadout. Or a Team Fortress 2 wannabe. When you are done with the game, it is one of the biggest reliefs you get in gaming as now you know you dont have to play this crap for the next minute. You get a prize with incredibly annoying music at the end of a round, and its usually something useless that you will never use. Not to mention, when I am looking through the people online, its the SAME 20 people from yesterday evening that was online. Oh, and don't even get me STARTED with the announcer. At first I thought he was the only good thing they did to this game, but later figured out I had to mute the announcers voice to prevent my ears from bleeding.Final Summary: Puts the UNREAL engine to shame with it's lazy developers and annoying announcements. 1/10 Would NEVER play again after getting the hats.

content:
Posted: April 22, 2015
												Well. I went to download this game because it looked alright, but truth is, it is almost the worst game I have ever played. There are NO players, the game is put together more like a tf2 clone than a MOBA, and the tutorial is worse than not having on at all.This sums up my experience: Wait 15 minutes for a match, then someone is global chat FINALLY responds to me, telling me people ONLY PLAY TURBOCROSS. So I queued up, got into a game, and proceded to get rekt. I asked for some helpful hints, and all I got was someone calling me a noob. Duh, 1st game.Aside for the face that there are literally 6 people on at one point, they are very toxic. The fact that this game even has the audacity to ask for my money makes me extremely upset. I waited a half hour to download this, and played for an hour. This is time I will never get back.Take my word for it, this is a horrible game, and you will only waste your time. Get Dota/Smite/Lol/Strife/Heroes of the Storm instead.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
												super monday night combat was a awsome looking game but when i got in omg it was hard. Well for one thing it took forever to find a match and some of the gamemodes are dead. When i finaly got into a match i began to play but after maybe 2 minutes they were telling me to get out i didnt respond back and the mechanics were a little diffrent from some games so i was confused for a bit. The gameplay was intresting for awhile then it got slowly degrading and boring. This game looks good no doubt about that but the lack of a community and veteran players hating noobies just draws away from the game. In a 1 to 10 score i give it a 4/10 the gameplay is not bad but a little confusing at first and second is the community being dead with whats left of it not completly willing to let new players in.

Posted: June 19, 2014
												Super MNC is great fun (despite some elements that can feel cheap or frustrating). The blend of shooter and MOBA feels fresh and unique, and combined with the over-the-top combat-sports world created by Uber, Super MNC is a blast to play. You may even be tempted to spend some money on it, given how awesome some of the costumes and taunts are (do yourself a favour and look up the Gunslinger's Judge Dredd uniform and Captain Spark's Action Hero taunt).Full review here: http://postlaunch.blogspot.ca/2012/09/super-mnc.html

content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
												I'm not sure what state this game is currently but as an avid supporter of both MNCs I do recommend giving it a try. The community is quite polarised, you will meet very helpful beings who want to have fun mixed with griefers who cheese turrets with the assassin and taunt in chat. The gameplay is honestly fantastic, this was my main game for a while, give it a try. A warning though, the learning curve is very steep and you will run into some very good players on your journey.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												Super MNC is great fun (despite some elements that can feel cheap or frustrating). The blend of shooter and MOBA feels fresh and unique, and combined with the over-the-top combat-sports world created by Uber, Super MNC is a blast to play. You may even be tempted to spend some money on it, given how awesome some of the costumes and taunts are (do yourself a favour and look up the Gunslinger's Judge Dredd uniform and Captain Spark's Action Hero taunt).Full review here: http://postlaunch.blogspot.ca/2012/09/super-mnc.html

content:
Posted: July 23, 2015
												rip in pieces ;_;Welp, it was fun while it lasted, that is until the developer decided to abandon this game completely. Concept was cool, gameplay introduces me a bit to the MOBA genre, and I was lucky enough to be able to pick up the pace to git gud. There's so much potential...I won't say much more, since other reviewers have noted too the downfall of the developer (starting from not fulfilling promises, inability to support the game through balances and listening to the community, and so on).Today the game merely exists as a shadow of its former self. There's almost no more players, though there are still a few who would attempt to pick a few visitors off the lobby to get their TF2 hats, in which you can certainly join but would still require you a lot of time to get to level 20.I put a 'no' on my recommendation simply because of the treatment that this game gets from its developers. But oh my if only you could play it during its glory days...

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												This is an extremely fun, simplistic 3rd person shooter MOBA. There's skills that you can upgrade upon leveling up, but no gear (weapons, armor, etc) to buy. There are power ups you can buy (bonus health, speed) (...and by buy, I mean buy with currency earned during the match.)  With the same currency you can also spawn creeps, rebuild destroyed towers, upgrade towers, activate traps, etc.However, the game is dead. Only a handful of people left playing, so good luck finding a match.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2015
												Started playing, played one game, waitied an hour trying to find another. ♥♥♥♥ing worthless.Then there's the problem that the UI doesn't scale, everyhting UI based looks like it was scaled for an old CRT montor resolution.The control scheme is total♥♥♥♥♥♥ Going from something like Borderlands or Dota that has that♥♥♥♥♥♥on lockdown to this is a ♥♥♥♥ing headache. Expect to waste your abilities constantly as you try tro do something as simple as sprint. Which you can't do, because that would require too much work from the devs.So, obviously while waiting in queue I did a bit of research, and it turns out that all 33 patches lost money, so the dev abandoned it. Its literally the definition of a dead game. Some poor guy tried to make patches for it himself with the sanction of Uber, he said that the problems are so extensive, they can't be fixed without an overhaul, which he isn't going to do in his spare time, because in the f2p game where they are still charging you for clothes, they can't possibly give any money to this lone guy who is obviously their biggest supporter.Its like someone had an idea to make a freemium game, and copy everything possible from Valve, down to the treasure chests and keys, and innovate as little as possible. If you want this style of game, Sanctum is better, Dota 2 is the great satan in the room that they tried to copy some of the MOBA elements from and TF2 is right over there, and Overwatch which promises to have at least a properly scaled and logical UI instead of the trash in this game.It really really sucks guys. Sorry.

												I find this game to be terrible. 												I played this game when it first came out.  The game itself is quite a bit of fun.  But unfortunately two things kill it.  The absolutely horrible player base.  Little kids who do nothing but yell at each other.  One day maybe games will require age restrictions to play and things will improve.  The second thing is no match making.  You get people who played for literally a year playing with people who just started today lol.  That killed it.  The game is dead.  If you are looking for a 3rd person moba try smite, its an actual moba.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												While the concept of this game might be good, it is a bit badly done.* Some things need real rebalancing. For example:- You can grab enemies in melee range and perform a cool animation which makes them lose a chunk of HP. Sounds neat, right? While doing that, everyone can shoot the two players and the poor victim can be grabbed afterwards. There are issues with who grabs who first and in the end of the animation, the victim gets kicked forward, so he can fall into a pit & die. You can make it worse by getting a product, which sets anyone who you grapple / grapples you on fire.- There is a class skill in the game that spams your screen with colorful, spinning ads (from the game, not actual ones) while also covering your HP which is in the upper middle of the screen.- Some classes have trap skills. Those can't be destroyed by enemy team as far as I know.- Some of the items, skills deal either terribly little damage or way too much.- Some bots have pretty huge AoE attacks that throw you back. Often out of the field. Respawn time takes up to 40 seconds later in the game.* The game is a bit dead.

number of helpful: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												High skill gaps, overpowered everything. No chance of winning unless you've been playing for a long time. High levels have tons of extra advantages and do nothing but steam roll everyone. Your damage is like 4 hp per shot while their damage is like 1/3 of your health. Even when you play safe, you have no chance of even getting a kill while you can't even leave your spawn. The shooting is no better than mediocre and the MOBA elements do not satisfy anyone.I thought this game being broken and unbalanced were just beta problems, but even now the game is horrendous.0/100

content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
 What would've been an amazing game destroyed by poor execution The only people who play anymore are either here for TF2 hats, OP level 100 players with all items, or just straight up hackers.So, what does togera think of SMNC?I like the game, the game is fun, the characters are funny and memorable but why can't I reccommend it?Most of the time your loadouts, Costumes, Products, or whatever will not even save after hitting save.Empty lobbies...and the never ending que...Hackers.....Hackers...(script kiddies as far as the eyes can see...)Overpowered Classes+Op products+Endorsements = *Your going to have a bad time.The worst part about the hackers is there is no vote kick and no first person spectate so you have to go and download the matches replay to watch them and see if they were cheating or not!The only lobbies that work are Turbocross and all the private matches, all the rest will plunge you into a never ending que.

Posted: June 29, 2015
												i  m not sure what to write here but here a recipe of pancakeIngredients:1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour3 tablespoons sugar1 tablespoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg2 large eggs, at room temperature1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as neededNow to make it1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla.3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat.4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed.6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2012
												After a brief 10 or so minute match, I remember why I hate this game. Stupid lame♥♥♥♥♥leavers who suffer no repercussions other than the fact they will have to wait for the game to finish (but if you dont wanna play it, its not like you cant just go play another game), dumb♥♥♥♥♥teammates who think anything is possible if you insta-lock the commando and go for grab kills on a tank who is 2 levels above you and worst of all - ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t connection services. At the start of the game, there were about 200 more Europeans than North Americans playing this game. Now, there are about 60 Europeans playing and about 700 North Americans which leaves you only one choice - to play on a server that is on the other side of the world and hope that the enemies are from Europe as well, but if they aren't - massive NA advantage over us Europeans. The gameplay is solid and fun, but only if you have friends to play it with, and even so, endorsements and products make the game too OP for any newcomers.

												All the jankiness of Monday Night Combat vanilla with none of the lessons developers should have learned from it, plus a community turning so toxic by the day that they keep having to shove out new waves of beta keys to get testers in as newbies go "♥♥♥♥ this" at the vets who abuse and steamroll them without mercy. Let's not even go into how mercenary the company has become as funds run low.EDIT: Even funnier: it only became a public beta because someone leaked an infinite-use key for it. Matchmaking is broken, masses of things are still in flux by the day, and there's no tutorial. This is how most people will see it because of loose lips. Good job, Uber! The best worst devs.

Product received for free
												Super Monday Night Combat, aka SMNC. Where did we go so wrong?Oh, I know where.The game died out some time ago, which is quite aggrovating. I only played this for the free TF2 hats (glad I got the Flamingo Kid), but I also wanted a game to play for a long time. This obviously wasn't my first choice. You got people sending random game invites, which are quite understandable, because the game's become a ghost town. The skill levels are heavily imbalanced, with newbies facing off against the P2Ps and the Higher-Ups/Vets.Don't download/install this game, unless you want to be in the game of lost hopes.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												Super Monday Night Combat is an innovative, third-person arena shooter.Pros: Graphics, Sound, Controls, GameplayCons: CommunityFrom the sleek Assassin to the hulking Jackbot, the graphics look superb. The music and sound mesh well with the gameplay, with the roaring crowd, gunfire, and cheeky advertisements. A controller or a keyboard and mouse work very well. Finally and above all else, Super Monday Night Combat is simply fun, standing out among numerous FPS clones and DotA-style mobas with unique and challenging mechanics.However, one simple flaw serves to demolish all fun to be had: the community has dwindled, leaving Super MNC's pick-up-and-play style a thing of the past.4/10

content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												According to all known lawsof aviation, there is no way a beeshould be able to fly. Its wings are too small to getits fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway because bees don't carewhat humans think is impossible. Yellow, black. Yellow, black.Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Ooh, black and yellow!Let's shake it up a little. Barry! Breakfast is ready! Ooming! Hang on a second. Hello? - Barry?- Adam? - Oan you believe this is happening?- I can't. I'll pick you up. Looking sharp. Use the stairs. Your fatherpaid good money for those. Sorry. I'm excited. Here's the graduate.We're very proud of you, son. A perfect report card, all B's. Very proud. Ma! I got a thing going here. - You got lint on your fuzz.- Ow! That's me! - Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.- Bye! Barry, I told you,stop flying in the house! - Hey, Adam.- Hey, Barry. - Is that fuzz gel?- A little. Special day, graduation. Never thought I'd make it. Three days grade school,three days high school. Those were awkward. Three days college. I'm glad I tooka day and hitchhiked around the hive. You did come back different. - Hi, Barry.- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. - Hear about Frankie?- Yeah. - You going to the funeral?- No, I'm not going. Everybody knows,sting someone, you die. Don't waste it on a squirrel.Such a hothead. I guess he could havejust gotten out of the way. I love this incorporatingan amusement park into our day. That's why we don't need vacations. Boy, quite a bit of pomp...under the circumstances. - Well, Adam, today we are men.- We are! - Bee-men.- Amen! Hallelujah! Students, faculty, distinguished bees, please welcome Dean Buzzwell. Welcome, New Hive Oitygraduating class of... ...9:15. That concludes our ceremonies. And begins your careerat Honex Industries! Will we pick ourjob today? I heard it's just orientation. Heads up! Here we go. Keep your hands and antennasinside the tram at all times. - Wonder what it'll be like?- A little scary. Welcome to Honex,a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you, as a bee,have worked your whole life to get to the point where youcan work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant PollenJocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top-secret formula is automatically color-corrected,scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctivegolden glow you know as... Honey! - That girl was hot.- She's my cousin! - She is?- Yes, we're all cousins. - Right. You're right.- At Honex, we constantly strive to improve every aspectof bee existence. These bees are stress-testinga new helmet technology. - What do you think he makes?- Not enough. Here we have our latest advancement,the Krelman. - What does that do?- Oatches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it.Saves us millions. Oan anyone work on the Krelman? Of course. Most bee jobs aresmall ones. But bees know that every small job,if it's done well, means a lot. But choose carefully because you'll stay in the jobyou pick for the rest of your life. The same job the rest of your life?I didn't know that. What's the difference? You'll be happy to know that bees,as a species, haven't had one day off in 27 million years. So you'll just work us to death? We'll sure try. Wow! That blew my mind! "What's the difference?"How can you say that? One job forever?That's an insane choice to have to make. I'm relieved. Now we only haveto make one decision in life. But, Adam, how could theynever have told us that? Why would you question anything?We're bees. We're the most perfectlyfunctioning society on Earth. You ever think maybe thingswork a little too well here? Like what? Give me one example. I don't know. But you knowwhat I'm talking about. Please clear the gate.Royal Nectar Force on approach. Wait a second. Oheck it out. - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!- Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's likeoutside the hive. Yeah, but some don't come back. - Hey, Jocks!- Hi, Jocks! You guys did great! You're monsters!You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it! - I wonder where they were.- I don't know. Their day's not planned. Outside the hive, flying who knowswhere, doing who knows what. You can'tjust decide to be a PollenJock. You have to be bred for that. Right. Look. That's more pollenthan you and I will see in a lifetime. It's just a status symbol.Bees make too much of it. Perhaps. Unless you're wearing itand the ladies see you wearing it. Those ladies?Aren't they our cousins too? Distant. Distant. Look at these two. - Oouple of Hive Harrys.- Let's have fun with them. It must be dangerousbeing a Pollen Jock. Yeah. Once a bear pinned meagainst a mushroom! He had a paw on my throat,and with the other, he was slapping me! - Oh, my!- I never thought I'd knock him out. What were you doing during this? Trying to alert the authorities. I can autograph that. A little gusty out there today,wasn't it, comrades? Yeah. Gusty. We're hitting a sunflower patchsix miles from here tomorrow. - Six miles, huh?- Barry! A puddle jump for us,but maybe you're not up for it. - Maybe I am.- You are not! We're going 0900 at J-Gate. What do you think, buzzy-boy?Are you bee enough? I might be. It all dependson what 0900 means. Hey, Honex! Dad, you surprised me. You decide what you're interested in? - Well, there's a lot of choices.- But you only get one. Do you ever get boreddoing the same job every day? Son, let me tell you about stirring. You grab that stick, and you justmove it around, and you stir it around. You get yourself into a rhythm.It's a beautiful thing. You know, Dad,the more I think about it, maybe the honey fieldjust isn't right for me. You were thinking of what,making balloon animals? That's a bad jobfor a guy with a stinger. Janet, your son's not surehe wants to go into honey! - Barry, you are so funny sometimes.- I'm not trying to be funny. You're not funny! You're goinginto honey. Our son, the stirrer! - You're gonna be a stirrer?- No one's listening to me! Wait till you see the sticks I have. I could say anything right now.I'm gonna get an ant tattoo! Let's open some honey and celebrate! Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.Shave my antennae. Shack up with a grasshopper. Geta gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"! I'm so proud. - We're starting work today!- Today's the day. Oome on! All the good jobswill be gone. Yeah, right. Pollen counting, stunt bee, pouring,stirrer, front desk, hair removal... - Is it still available?- Hang on. Two left! One of them's yours! Oongratulations!Step to the side. - What'd you get?- Picking crud out. Stellar! Wow! Oouple of newbies? Yes, sir! Our first day! We are ready! Make your choice. - You want to go first?- No, you go. Oh, my. What's available? Restroom attendant's open,not for the reason you think. - Any chance of getting the Krelman?- Sure, you're on. I'm sorry, the Krelman just closed out. Wax monkey's always open. The Krelman opened up again. What happened? A bee died. Makes an opening. See?He's dead. Another dead one. Deady. Deadified. Two more dead. Dead from the neck up.Dead from the neck down. That's life! Oh, this is so hard! Heating, cooling

content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												According to all known lawsof aviation, there is no way a beeshould be able to fly. Its wings are too small to getits fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway because bees don't carewhat humans think is impossible. Yellow, black. Yellow, black.Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Ooh, black and yellow!Let's shake it up a little. Barry! Breakfast is ready! Ooming! Hang on a second. Hello? - Barry?- Adam? - Oan you believe this is happening?- I can't. I'll pick you up. Looking sharp. Use the stairs. Your fatherpaid good money for those. Sorry. I'm excited. Here's the graduate.We're very proud of you, son. A perfect report card, all B's. Very proud. Ma! I got a thing going here. - You got lint on your fuzz.- Ow! That's me! - Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.- Bye! Barry, I told you,stop flying in the house! - Hey, Adam.- Hey, Barry. - Is that fuzz gel?- A little. Special day, graduation. Never thought I'd make it. Three days grade school,three days high school. Those were awkward. Three days college. I'm glad I tooka day and hitchhiked around the hive. You did come back different. - Hi, Barry.- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. - Hear about Frankie?- Yeah. - You going to the funeral?- No, I'm not going. Everybody knows,sting someone, you die. Don't waste it on a squirrel.Such a hothead. I guess he could havejust gotten out of the way. I love this incorporatingan amusement park into our day. That's why we don't need vacations. Boy, quite a bit of pomp...under the circumstances. - Well, Adam, today we are men.- We are! - Bee-men.- Amen! Hallelujah! Students, faculty, distinguished bees, please welcome Dean Buzzwell. Welcome, New Hive Oitygraduating class of... ...9:15. That concludes our ceremonies. And begins your careerat Honex Industries! Will we pick ourjob today? I heard it's just orientation. Heads up! Here we go. Keep your hands and antennasinside the tram at all times. - Wonder what it'll be like?- A little scary. Welcome to Honex,a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you, as a bee,have worked your whole life to get to the point where youcan work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant PollenJocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top-secret formula is automatically color-corrected,scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctivegolden glow you know as... Honey! - That girl was hot.- She's my cousin! - She is?- Yes, we're all cousins. - Right. You're right.- At Honex, we constantly strive to improve every aspectof bee existence. These bees are stress-testinga new helmet technology. - What do you think he makes?- Not enough. Here we have our latest advancement,the Krelman. - What does that do?- Oatches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it.Saves us millions. Oan anyone work on the Krelman? Of course. Most bee jobs aresmall ones. But bees know that every small job,if it's done well, means a lot. But choose carefully because you'll stay in the jobyou pick for the rest of your life. The same job the rest of your life?I didn't know that. What's the difference? You'll be happy to know that bees,as a species, haven't had one day off in 27 million years. So you'll just work us to death? We'll sure try. Wow! That blew my mind! "What's the difference?"How can you say that? One job forever?That's an insane choice to have to make. I'm relieved. Now we only haveto make one decision in life. But, Adam, how could theynever have told us that? Why would you question anything?We're bees. We're the most perfectlyfunctioning society on Earth. You ever think maybe thingswork a little too well here? Like what? Give me one example. I don't know. But you knowwhat I'm talking about. Please clear the gate.Royal Nectar Force on approach. Wait a second. Oheck it out. - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!- Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's likeoutside the hive. Yeah, but some don't come back. - Hey, Jocks!- Hi, Jocks! You guys did great! You're monsters!You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it! - I wonder where they were.- I don't know. Their day's not planned. Outside the hive, flying who knowswhere, doing who knows what. You can'tjust decide to be a PollenJock. You have to be bred for that. Right. Look. That's more pollenthan you and I will see in a lifetime. It's just a status symbol.Bees make too much of it. Perhaps. Unless you're wearing itand the ladies see you wearing it. Those ladies?Aren't they our cousins too? Distant. Distant. Look at these two. - Oouple of Hive Harrys.- Let's have fun with them. It must be dangerousbeing a Pollen Jock. Yeah. Once a bear pinned meagainst a mushroom! He had a paw on my throat,and with the other, he was slapping me! - Oh, my!- I never thought I'd knock him out. What were you doing during this? Trying to alert the authorities. I can autograph that. A little gusty out there today,wasn't it, comrades? Yeah. Gusty. We're hitting a sunflower patchsix miles from here tomorrow. - Six miles, huh?- Barry! A puddle jump for us,but maybe you're not up for it. - Maybe I am.- You are not! We're going 0900 at J-Gate. What do you think, buzzy-boy?Are you bee enough? I might be. It all dependson what 0900 means. Hey, Honex! Dad, you surprised me. You decide what you're interested in? - Well, there's a lot of choices.- But you only get one. Do you ever get boreddoing the same job every day? Son, let me tell you about stirring. You grab that stick, and you justmove it around, and you stir it around. You get yourself into a rhythm.It's a beautiful thing. You know, Dad,the more I think about it, maybe the honey fieldjust isn't right for me. You were thinking of what,making balloon animals? That's a bad jobfor a guy with a stinger. Janet, your son's not surehe wants to go into honey! - Barry, you are so funny sometimes.- I'm not trying to be funny. You're not funny! You're goinginto honey. Our son, the stirrer! - You're gonna be a stirrer?- No one's listening to me! Wait till you see the sticks I have. I could say anything right now.I'm gonna get an ant tattoo! Let's open some honey and celebrate! Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.Shave my antennae. Shack up with a grasshopper. Geta gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"! I'm so proud. - We're starting work today!- Today's the day. Oome on! All the good jobswill be gone. Yeah, right. Pollen counting, stunt bee, pouring,stirrer, front desk, hair removal... - Is it still available?- Hang on. Two left! One of them's yours! Oongratulations!Step to the side. - What'd you get?- Picking crud out. Stellar! Wow! Oouple of newbies? Yes, sir! Our first day! We are ready! Make your choice. - You want to go first?- No, you go. Oh, my. What's available? Restroom attendant's open,not for the reason you think. - Any chance of getting the Krelman?- Sure, you're on. I'm sorry, the Krelman just closed out. Wax monkey's always open. The Krelman opened up again. What happened? A bee died. Makes an opening. See?He's dead. Another dead one. Deady. Deadified. Two more dead. Dead from the neck up.Dead from the neck down. That's life! Oh, this is so hard! Heating, cooling

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
												The only reason I'm playing this game is for the Pyro hat. I only have this much time in because of it.I honestly hate this game. The voice acting, the gameplay, the graphics, the music... everything. Even the loading screens. Okay, now I understand some people love it, and the creators put a lot of work into it. You go, creators. HOWEVER, that does not change my recommendation or my opinion. This game tries to be new and revolutionary, and the concept isn't bad, but the execution sucked. If you think you might like this game for what it is instead of a way to get two hats, hear me out. I thought I was going to enjoy it too. But this is just... Not enjoyable. It's boring, the music and sound effects are annoying, and don't get me started with the announcer. I'm just chugging through it because the pyro hat is really friggin awesome.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2013
												Super Monday Night Combat is a class-based, free-to-play third-person multiplayer shooter.The game is a televised futuristic death-sport that has two teams of five fighting each other in hopes of escorting bots to the enemies’ base and destroying their coin-filled moneyball. Doing this will require teamwork, upgrading your players, protecting your team’s bots and destroying the enemy’s turrets. During play, you will level up and are allowed to spend your points on upgrading your three abilities or your defense and attack power. You will also gain money for purchasing stat boosters, jump pads to reach higher places and waves of bots to send at your opponents. After a game is over, your profile will gain experience points.Super Monday Night Combat is well worth your time if you are looking for a free shooter. It has a large variety of characters, great maps and is not a pay to win game.Sounds 5/10Graphics 4/10Gameplay 6/10Atmosphere 6/10If you liked my review, please feel free to follow me and/or my curator group:http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ov3RT4K3R/myworkshopfiles/?section=guideshttp://steamcommunity.com/groups/orcollective#curationAlso feel free to check out my YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC83DYCmrWfl9ttrhX54jmWA

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 19, 2012
												Poor match-making system, buggy, poor menu layout, poor character diversity and unbalanced classes... but actually pretty darn fun when you can get in to a game.If TF2 and DotA had a child, then you'd end up with this game.  Robots continously spawn and follow paths to the other team's base.  You're responsible for clearing the way for the robots so that you can pop the other team's money ball and win.  You level up as you go in the match and spend money to spawn robots, open hidden paths or heal yourself.If you like TF2 and are familiar with DotA game mechanics, then you'll probably like this.  Assuming they ever polish it up and fix the numerous issues.  A temporary distraction between better games.

Well, Super MNC is like a wet dream for a gamer of my background because it marries the 2 genres pretty good imho.Cons:UI is kinda weird and confusing at firstMatchmaking works but then doesn't, im seeing alot of mixed resultsonly 15 pros/champions (for now)Apparently this game purposely took the DoTa formula which im all for :-) and they promise constant updates, which in 2 days i've already seen evidence of this THANKFULLY!So give it some time and help the community grow because so far the Devs are showing love as far as im concerned

content:
Posted: June 25, 2012
												More tactical? Yes. Still fast paced? Yes. Not pay to win? Yes. Reminds me of yet another TF2 clone? Yes. Thus, I don't play this. I don't want to sit around and try and build a team to play. No, I'd like to just jump in and have fun. But with Super MNC.... if your team is complete garbage, YOU LOSE. If you're team is slightly stupid. YOU LOSE. If the other team has slightly more coordination than you? YOU LOSE.It no longer really MATTERS how good YOU are. Which is fine. I can appreciate a good team based game. But there has to be a point where you can actually make a difference. In this game, you can't. Hell, headshots don't even have that much of a point anymore. No more "one shot" type deals. Unless you ejector someone. Or grab someone and toss them. Only two ways, thus, no one really hangs around the edges. Unless of course, you know, they're new and don't know what they're doing. Thus, you'll lose.TL;DRTF2 clone with a MOBA style game play.If Team Sucks? Rage quit.

												I still recommend this game despite the fact that going F2P only hurt the experience. The original MNC was a fairly balanced game that suffered from a bad map or two, Super MNC has vastly improved maps and a stronger focus on supporting the bots versus attacking other players. While the shift of focus to the bots is great and how the original game was intended to play out sadly it ends up not making a difference with the pay to win classes and endorsements/perks. The fact the the more unbalanced a character is the more they cost shows that this is by design. It is still fun to play but your game might be cut short by someone that just bought their way to your money ball.

												It's pretty fun. It can be considered a MOBA, but it plays like a third-person action game so it feels more accessable. Even so, there will be those who get annoyed at "noobs" and the player population is kind of low right now so just queueing up randomly takes forever. I recommend forming groups using the in-game chat. My favorite mode is Blitz, which is 5 human players versus waves of AI bots. That mode is cooperative instead of competitive, hence why I enjoy it more.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 24, 2012
												For those who are big on action, Inuyasha has plenty of that to go around, as well. The violence, which usually involves Inuyasha slashing and hacking away at demons, can be a bit graphic and bloody at times, and is not for the younger readers. It's a good thing Yasha is part demon; if he were fully human, he'd NEVER survive most of the fights that he takes part in. Indeed, because of the violence and bloodshed (and brief, rare nudity), I'm inclined to give this the "Teens Only" label. Fortunately, the characters and story DO NOT take a back seat to the fighting, so it's not like watching "Dragon Ball Z" with demons.The artwork for Inuyasha (both the Manga and the Anime) is excellent, as is expected from Takahashi. She has a smooth, clean shonen artwork style; it could be viewed as a bit cartoonish because of the lack of details, but it's simple, and pleasing to the eye; very similar to the later works of Kosuke Fujishima (creator of "Oh My Goddess!" and "You're Under Arrest!").

content:
Posted: July 12, 2013
												This game is one of the most poorly balanced, steaming piles of crap I have ever played. The main reason is the stupid ♥♥♥♥ing grapple mechanic. With certain weapons and when in range, you can press the right mouse button which locks players into an animation AND does about 1/3 of their health bars worth of damage. It takes what should be a very smart blend of third-person shooting and tactical MOBA gameplay and flushes it down the toliet with such an easy to use method of getting kills.  MNC started with a good idea but diluated it with stuff put in to cater to casual noobs who like flashy animations. And if you really want a good third-person MOBA, check out Smite.

												More tactical? Yes. Still fast paced? Yes. Not pay to win? Yes. Reminds me of yet another TF2 clone? Yes. Thus, I don't play this. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 17, 2012
												Comparison to the first, is not exactly fair in this case, this is more of an issue of MNC feeling like the beta to this being the full.Its free to play, (at least for now) so give it a try.  Now, something to keep in mind for old schoolers of MNC, this is not the OMGOHKfest of the original. Teamwork is needed, there is no replacing turrets, and well, its a lot more DotAesque.   Another unfair comparison, is to tf2. This doesnt have the soloist, instant gratification of tf2, No crocket/uber wins here.  Now, for everyone else..IF you are looking for a really decent TEAM based game, you got it.IF you think strategy is more then spam healing, and crits, you got it.IF you like strategy games, but hated the inability to evade simple attacks, you got it.IF you like shooting things along the way, well... you get the idea. This game posesses possibly the strongest emphasis on team play of any I've come across so far, and uniquely balanced characters who hold their roles well.

												I came in expecting a tf2 clone, just third person.  How wrong I was.  Take TF2 and DOTA/LoL and you get this.  Usually charming/amusing (though the announcers can get old), this combines a well done mixture of strategy and gunplay with it's many unique classes. Well worth a download.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Played this game like crazy, but never bothered to review it. SMNC is a fantastic game! It is sad though that as time went on, the player population dwindled. All that remained in the matchmaking queue was experienced teams dominating the newbies. There's just not much incentive to play if there's hardly anybody playing or if the playing field isn't level, especially for new people. Also another thing is that Uber pretty much has stopped supporting the game for a long while now. That is sad because this game is great and has many fans(especially me). When they started working on Planetary Annihilation, that was pretty much the death blow to this game.I haven't fired up the game in many months, so I don't know what the climate is now, but i'll always remember the good times! Particularly in 2012 and early 2013, when there were many people playing and was fully supported!

content:
Posted: March 4, 2014
												I have many complaints about this game.  It's abandoned by the developers.  New players are discouraged by obsessive fans.  There's not much learning to do but it is all painful without any way to practice or learn easily.  Moba-inspired mechanics catastrophically mixed with instant death traps, tiny maps and a real lack for any players to find shelter due to most abilities and a number of weapons having infinite range without falloff (most weapons still do almost no damage but prohibit regen at distance) Still a fun, intense, hectic game.  It scratched an itch that's hard to reach and the artists are incredibly talented.A pity the developers do not care about this brand and completely failed to learn from their mistakes people complained heavily about during the run of the game's predecessor, Monday Night Combat, which is also dead.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 29, 2012
												Bacon bacon bacon! The announcers blare out as I pick up an item that decreases my skills cooldown, increase my health regeneration, and increase my speed. As I blitz across the arena on my bacon fed Pro, I jump into action to save a healer being snared by the enemy.My three activated skills come off cooldown and I blind the enemy players, charge into them to knock them into my lane's minions and tower. The healer I just saved switches his gun from a healing beam to a life-draining, slowing beam to keep the enemy team in place. The rest of my team comes out of the jungle to turn this 5 vs 1 gank into a multi-kill and assist fest as the overextended team get cut to shreds by the combined power of our tower, minions, and damage skills by our characters.The most important tip I can give in playing this third person battle arena is, like other DOTA-esque games, is to kill the minions, protect the lanes, and don't overextend unless you're sure you won't get ganked. A shooter this is not

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 5, 2012
												Remember the original Monday Night Combat? Well now think of it but with way more playable characters. Remember how people talk about there being a 10th class in TF2? Well this game has gone 10th class and BEYOND!That's what Super MNC is. Lead your robots to the enemy Moneyball as your old favourites such as the super-optimistic Assault or the silent and sneaky Assassin, or as one of the new and unexpected faces of the competition such as the hulking Veteran, the over-the-top gorilla actor Cheston, the cute yet tough rollerskating Megabeth, the living boombox Robohobo, the loony and twisted Wascot, or Leonardo Da Vinci himself!Also, enjoy full-colour commentary and the hilarious antics of SMNC's new announcers: The constantly divorced GG Stack and retired MNC veteran Chip Valvano.The Rules Have Changed, but the action stays the same. It's Monday night, the bacon and churros are still delicious, and the Pros are ready!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												I had high hopes for this game, after playing so much of the first one. Boy was I disappointed by SMNC. The appeal the first game had was that it was a wacky take on "Monday Night" Sports events with guns and explosions, with a splash of Dota and tower defense. This is not what I wanted, a disgusting "Poke-War" like Dota and LoL, "Jungling" and a god-awful grind to make your character better. The first game had silly, 12 on 12 games, with frantic combat, and a TF2-esque charm. The charm from the dialogue still exists, but it sadly couldn't cover for the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ization of the thing I loved. If you played the first game and liked it, this is not for you.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2012
												You should play this game for the same reason you should play Team Fortress 2: It's free, it's amazing, and if you don't like it you don't really lose anything from trying. This game has the most precise and amazing balance I've ever seen in a game. It seems like if you made some characters do even 1 less point of damage per shot, the whole game would fall apart. This game reaks of the delicious aroma of effort and thought. Also, you get 2 hats in TF2, which I know you have because you are on steam, so I know you want more hats. Get Super MNC, because if you don't like it, you at least get dem hats.

												♦Highly recommended♦ I've played this game for a couple of hours (from the time of this post) now and so far I have enjoyed every aspect of the game. Although due to the fact of less players online playing it its harder to find games but still its great to play with friends. Very easy to learn. What I like about Super MNC is that it needs low requirements to run a heavy looking game. I had managed to play it with a bit of lag on my Lenovo X131e mini laptop and still had fun!. If you want fun, teamwork, interactive game then I do suggest downloading Super MNC. Oh and if you play Team Fortress 2 (TF2) then when you gain every achievement you get two hats.♦ TF2 PLAYERS AND ACHIEVEMENT GAINERS NOTICE:You will not get your achievements right away you may need to play one more game before you can get your achievement!!!♦

No one plays this.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2012
												Fairly fun, hard to learn due to a lame tutorial. The weapons are not explained at all anywhere that I can find, so you might play for 5 mins as the tank before you realize your laser only has a 5 foot range even though it looks significantly longer...  The menu is atrocious though. I hate the ascetic (Maybe its just too "ESPN" for my tastes) and the info that's there is hard to find. It took me at least 10 mins of searching just to figure out how much champions cost (And whether I owned any or not.)  and I'm still not clear on whether the weapons cost only dollars or if they can be bought with earned currency and if they change the stats or not...Other than that, the gameplay is fun when you get the hang of it. It's TF2-y but most weapons on Champions I've played have been crazy short range. It seems it inheritad TF2's weapon falloff but amped up the percentage.It's free. You should play it.

												A very stylish MOBA game. The gameplay involves a lot of familiar elements from Dota and League of Legends, like lane pushing, creep spawns and jungle mobs, but realizes them in a 3rd person shooter game. It's quite an enjoyable and different experience, but it requires some serious dedication to adjust to this style of gameplay. The game is also punishingly difficult for newcomers because of the small and experienced playerbase.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												Don't think this game is bad despite all odds, you're judging a book by its cover. Infact, its probably until 4 in-game hours and a couple healthy questions you can begin loving it for what it is. If you're entering the game just going for the hats while keeping a closed mind towards the game and its contents, then shame on you. Its a lot more than a way to get hats.Now here are some things which can ruin your fun in Super MNC.1. Picking assassin all the time thinking she's similar to Spy (tf2) or a cool class   -she takes skill and the fundementals and basics of Super MNC needs to be understood and mastered before her use2. Comparing it to TF2   -its a different game, very different, gameplay is more team based, objectives are different, and its more interactive3. Just spamming for Super Crossfire, ect teams   -its smart to find them, but if you can't get just enter search for a game.4. Going in expecting easy wins and kills   -you aren't gonna win em all, you aren't gonna instantly understand the game, time will fix these tho5. Going for powerleveling / TF2 hats   -that's just God awful and sad. Use the time to get a part time job, make around 15 bucks, spend it to get hats, more  -  -   economical than wasting everyone's time.A few things I should tell you about the game tho:1. The creators, they have left the game, so no more development, but, in any case, the game is pretty complete anyway2. Lobbies are nearly always dead    -blame this on the dying communities, which we need to fuel, advertise this game and get it more reception3. Most people playing now are TF2 diehard fan-kids who just want the hats, they're gonna bash the ♥♥♥♥ outta this game for no valid reason other than being themselves4. If you think that the mode is boring, sad news, there are only 3 modes, but atleast, they're fun anyway.My overally ratings for Super MNC is very high. Remove the problems based on the community, it has a fun immersive gameplay and a good enough MC. It is one of those games you can really enjoy when you're out of other things or just want to play something different. I highly reccomend you get this game, and tell your friends about it too.See you on the battlefield~

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 12, 2016
												Think I wrote a review on this before, but I didn't say much and it's asking me to do one again.  So in short:Great game, but died earlier than it should've.  One day I decided I wanted to play this again and there was almost no one all of a sudden (this was awhile ago, but this game just reappeared in my queue).  Back in its prime the search times were good, but now I'd be lucky if if went to bed and woke up to see one.My "not reviewer grade" Pros:-Incredibly fun.  Even when losing I could have the fun I don't see in a lot of MOBAs.-Pretty unique.  I think my first time playing this was a thought of TF2 and League of Legends Combined, which wasn't bad as I loved both games (I tried it out for the free TF2 stuff originally).-Wasn't toxic like so many other MOBA communities.  I was never told once to be euthanized or anything similar and I never met the overly cocky "pros" at the game.-Casual-Humorous.  The announcers were great and some of the characters were pretty funny.  My favorite had to be Wascot and his obsession with Bullseye.-Never experienced much lag or anything.  Can't say that for some MOBAs (looking at you LoL or Smite).-Cons-My only real con was that it somehow died unexpectedly at least to me.If this game made a comeback I would totally join in once again. 10/10 in my opinion.

Posted: June 24, 2015
It would seem that the Hotshots have activated the Steam Review, Chip!Super Monday Night Combat is a mixture of Dota 2, SMITE, TF2 and Brawl Busters and like Brawl Busters, this game is nearly dead. Infact i think it's UNDEAD at this point. Anyway, You have multiple characters to play as such as an alternate version of The Ultimate Warrior, a Fanboy who went full on Yandere-Psychopath and is one of the most pain in the♥♥♥♥♥characters to deal with, Mario with a Medigun and a shotgun (You can even get a TF2 Medipack!), Donkey Kong in a suit, Leonardo Da Vinci, Combat Girl who is best girl out of the Pit Girls and the list goes on for another 12 more characters. With a whopping TWENTY-FIVE PLAYERS i am amazed that this game's online servers are still up. If you ever want to be the 26th, then try this game out for a spin. Play enough and you will even be rewarded with TF2 Hats. Oh and don't forget...THE RULES HAVE CHANGED.

												Really fun MOBA game.  Plays like a mix of TF2 and DOTA. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												Oh wow. I actually have yet to review this game. I really have some work to do then.Pros:+ Gameplay is completely unique, with a refreshing blend of MOBA and third person shooter mechanics+ Characters all seam unique in a way, and still hold true to many of the usual MOBA classifications+ Announcer commentary in game is incredibly funny+ Free bonus TF2 hats (Always a nice touch)+ Can act as a good way to get people who are new to MOBA games into the mechanics+ Free+ Character dialog is just as good as that of the announcers+ Unlockable characters wont cost you to much money, and getting them from gameplay isnt to hardCons:- Community presence, or lack there of, makes finding matches a challange- Clearly a game designed to have a larger player base than it currently does (Grinds are made hard by lack of matches)- Map designs are pretty small, creating some gameplay problems (Things get clausterphobic in a big hurry)Summary:This is a top noch game that really deserves more than it gets from gamers. If you are lucky enough to have 10 or so friends, who also kind of like MOBAs, then why dont you have this game? The bad news is, the player community has dropped off a lot. So the game can feel like a 6/10 when it deserves a 9/10. Sad but true.Overall: 8/10, Needs the community agian.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												For people who don't want to sit through a long explanation of why this game is good and how more people should be playing and just want the TF2 hats I'll give you a few tips*play blitz, it's the easiest game mode to get xp on, it only requires 5 players and is co-op, so you can find a game pretty quickly, just set up a game and invite everyone in public chat*use these codes, they're for xp boosts and will help you burn through the levels quickly, however I reccomend using them once you've gotten through the easier levels so starting in the 5-10 level region: 2718-28184070-9098Okay, now we're through that, is the game any good? Simply put, yes, yes it is. I find all the modes quite fun, blitz is good if you like TF2's MvM, but wish there was some sort of survival mode, turbocross and super crossfire are very similar, however it is a lot easier to get a game on turbocross. The pros have a good mix of roles, mainly focused on either attacking or defending, with even the support based classes having the ability to deal decent damage. The characters are also very entertaining with very distinct personalities.Gamemodes:*BlitzBlitz is a 5 player co-op mode, where you defend your moneyball against increasing hordes of robots, a lot of fun to play with friends, also helps you to get a hang of difficult classes. A good tip for playing this mode is to keep turrets healed, so having either a support or combat girl is a must*super crossfire and turbocrossBoth very similar, basically each team is trying to take down either side's moneyball, to do this you must guide your robots through, killing enemy robots, players and turrets. The only real difference between these two gamemodes is that turbocross moves a lot faster, the differences can be read here: http://mondaynightcombat.wikia.com/wiki/TurbocrossPros:Pros are the name in this game of what heroes are to dota and what classes are to TF2. There is a very good selection and you'll almost certainly find at least one that fits your playstyle. Like sniping? Choose sniper or artemis. Like upclose and personal action? Veteran and captain spark will likely be your jam. Like going on the sneaky beaky? Then you'll likely love assassin. Why is this game dead?Well actually, it isn't. It's very small but far from dead. It's only really hard to get games on super crossfire, blitz and turbocross are played very much. What the game really suffered from is poor matchmaking, it's not possible to join a game half way through, and it also lacks any sort of server browser, making you rely on their strange party matchmaking system to get into games.Final Verdict:This game is fun, and good for those who are hesitant towards MOBAs but enjoy shooters. It mainly suffered from poor matchmaking and an audience that migrated towards DOTA and LoL, it could really benefit from having more players as it's only real problem is having too small of a community. (Also, if you like the game and are thinking of supporting it, don't buy the turbocross bundle, get the pro pack, it's the same price and comes with all pros, all their blitz gear and 2 taunts for each pro)Edit:These are some of my major gripes with SMNC, as I feel I should mention some of the negative along with the positive*grappleDear god is grapple important in smnc, however, it feels to much like it was handed out between pros willy nilly. The biggest issue is every pro can grapple, however, whereas the commando pros (assassin, captain spark, and wascot) rely on grapple to do most of their damage,  other stronger classes can also grapple, the main ones that really make this a problem is megabeth and combat girl, they do a lot of damage from their weapons and are by no means reliant on it to do damage, however, they can easily knock off a third of your health by grappling you, and the effect of ping can sometimes cause them to grapple you first, quickly killing you, as they may not kill you with a grapple, but they can easily finish you off with ranged capability you don't have. This is perhaps the largest balance issue in the game, as it often feels unfair when a pro that you've expertly hunted can kill you due to a split second difference in grapple.*communicationit is very hard, and has been poorly implemented. There is no real way to use proper voice communication, making you rely on text chat and voice commands, this is problematic as smnc, whilst not as reliant on communcation as something like Guns of Icarus, has the communication aspect as an important part of the gameplay.

It would seem that the Hotshots have activated the Steam Review, Chip!Super Monday Night Combat is a mixture of Dota 2, SMITE, TF2 and Brawl Busters and like Brawl Busters, this game is nearly dead. Anyway, You have multiple characters to play as such as an alternate version of The Ultimate Warrior, a Fanboy who went full on Yandere-Psychopath and is one of the most pain in the♥♥♥♥♥characters to deal with, Mario with a Medigun and a shotgun (You can even get a TF2 Medipack!), Donkey Kong in a suit, Leonardo Da Vinci, Combat Girl who is best girl out of the Pit Girls and the list goes on for another 12 more characters. Play enough and you will even be rewarded with TF2 Hats. Oh and don't forget...THE RULES HAVE CHANGED.

												Start with the class-based shooter teamplay of TF2, add generous helpings of MOBA design principles, and put it all in a highly-commercialized "Sisyphean nightmare" of a future, as commentated by announcers inspired by John Madden and Charles Barkley. You'll laugh, you'll rage, you'll blow up robots, you'll fight Leonardo DaVinci, you'll make a farm of kittie bots, you'll get beaten up by a gorilla, you'll shoot a guy in a giant foam suit, you'll ride a chicken, you'll call down the thunder from on high to bring pain and agony to your enemies. Don't get killed, blow up the bots, and maybe you'll bring victory to your arbitrarily assigned team for the entertainment of the commercialized and gullible masses and the profit of your corporate overlords.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2012
												This game is fantastic, but there is a wicked learning curve, as with any MOBA.That's right, this game is a MOBA. If you are coming for a shooter (e.g. "I just want the TF2 hats!") you will be disappointed. Oh, there is shooting. Lots of shooting. It's just that your shooting skills won't be nearly as important as your sense of teamwork and map awareness.The blance between characters is pretty good, although certain characters will feel OP or UP until you learn to play against them or as them, respectively.Also, the content in this game can be purchased through microtransactions, but all the core gameplay elements can be achieved for FREE within a reasonable time frame through playing games with a rotating free character roster. If you are familiar with League of Legends, the store is basically exactly like that.Ultimately, a very fun and rewarding game, if you stick with it. Don't play for just the TF2 hats, people will hate you.

												This game, back when people played it, was the bees knees (yeah, I just said "bees knees"). You may not play it to often, but when you do, I can promise that you will have fun.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2012
												For those who are big on action, Inuyasha has plenty of that to go around, as well. The violence, which usually involves Inuyasha slashing and hacking away at demons, can be a bit graphic and bloody at times, and is not for the younger readers. It's a good thing Yasha is part demon; if he were fully human, he'd NEVER survive most of the fights that he takes part in. Indeed, because of the violence and bloodshed (and brief, rare nudity), I'm inclined to give this the "Teens Only" label. Fortunately, the characters and story DO NOT take a back seat to the fighting, so it's not like watching "Dragon Ball Z" with demons.The artwork for Inuyasha (both the Manga and the Anime) is excellent, as is expected from Takahashi. She has a smooth, clean shonen artwork style; it could be viewed as a bit cartoonish because of the lack of details, but it's simple, and pleasing to the eye; very similar to the later works of Kosuke Fujishima (creator of "Oh My Goddess!" and "You're Under Arrest!").
