												For the love of all that is good and righteous, KILL THE BOTS!!!!!!^Really, this one of the best advice you will ever get when starting this game.Super MNC is one of those games that showed so much promise and could be so much more then what is it now. One of the game biggest downfall was it large learning curve. A lot of players had a hard time adjusting and just quit. It doesn't help that SMNC doesn't have a good traning mode or tutorial.If you are reading this then please, I implore you to give this game a try. SMNC voice acting, funny quips, and outlandish premise will slowly grow a place in your heart, leaving you wanting more. The gameplay is a mixture of DoTa 2 and Team Fortress 2. With the essences of team strategy from DoTa 2 and the fast pace action of Team Fortress 2, this combernation of the two gameplay style works so well and create a very unique experience. As stated before, the game learning cruve is it downfall. An avid Team Fortress 2 player might come in with the mind set of treating this as anyother shooter game and ignore the main objective.I want to highly recommend this game to everyone, but this game is on a life line. Holding on the best it can with what left of it's community. The best way to revive Super Monday Night Combat is by spreading the word. The more players we have, the better it will get! I'm going to end this with a quote from one of the commentator of SMNC."If you enjoy SMNC, tell a friend. Your opinion matter to them. If you don't like SMNC, then keep it to yourself. No one cares about your opinion" - GG StacksGeneral Tips:NewbiePlayer: JustLife, I am soo great at FPS games and can hold my own in any shooter. Why do I keep dieing to that other player(s)? This game cheats and suck.JustLife: Remember my advice at the top of the review where I said, kill the bots.....well, yeah...KILL THE BOTS!!!! NewbiePlayer: Yes, I vaguely recall you saying something like that but why can't I just go for player kills and leave the bots to my noob teammates?JustLife: It's all about a Pro levels. The higher your level is, the more skills/upgrade you have which in turn gives you an edge in pvp. Example:(SuperCross mode) Let's say your level 2 overextending into the opposing side and you see this level 5 Gorilla with a tommy gun sturting around like he owns the place. You get the drop on him and unload your mag. You take out 2, maybe 3 bars of his hp. During this timeframe, he charge you into a wall, slam you to the floor, and then proceed to club you to death. What a cheat! You totally had the advantage, right? WRONG. The higher the level gap between you and your opponets, the less damage you do to them.NewbiePlayer: Ok, but how does killing bots help me beat other players?JustLife: Killing bots give you money, the more money you collect, the faster you level up, the faster you level up, the more better equiped you are at beating another player. Also as a side effect of you killing opposing team bots, it will allow your team bots to take down your opponent turrets, which will lead them to dropping there money ball and give you the opening to win the game! And maybe, just maybe one of your bots might get lucky with a cheep pot shot at a fleeing opponent pro and kill them >:DSuper Blitz Game Mode:TL:DR - Lazer Blazer and Long Shot Turret are useless in Blitzs. DO NOT BUILD THEM. Rockit and a few ShaveIce Turret are the best set up.Lazer Blazer: You pay for cheep, you get cheep. They will only last, at best up to 20+ waves before they get eaten up by Jackbot and Gapshot bot. DO NOT BUILD (unless nessacery and even then, don't. Better to lose a few hp off the money ball and save up for rockits then to gimp your team at later waves)Long Shot: In Turbo, they are great for there long range and does a good amount of damage. In Blitzs, they are next to USELESS! Longshot fires a missle upward and then arch downward hitting there targets. The Blitzs arena has an upper level Ring that covers the bottom. The main Bot waves travels underneath the top Ring, Long Shot missle will hit the top ring and miss everything! DO NOT BUILD (Exception are the two starting Long Shot on the side of the map)BUILD ROCKIT AND SHAVEICE TURRETS:Rockit Turret: Does alot of damage and kill bots fast. The perfect Turret for Blitzs.ShaveIce: What it lack in offense, it make up for in defense. ShaveIce has the most HP of any turrets, capable of surviving an onslaught attack of a Jackbot. It's chilling ability slows down bots, at times bunching them up and allow the rockit turrets extra hits and giving your team more time to react to the approching waves of bots. The best turret placement are:4 Rockits by the MoneyballAlternate between ShaveIce and Rockits on the outter area. Try not to place two ShaveIce next to eachother.

												Hilarious, fun, challenging and easy to learn. Lots of mods, skins but very little cheating due to the game mechanics and make-up. Just not need to cheat, because as you level and get better you make more money to stay competative.Also its a team game, and not monopolized by a bunch of trolls making a team beating on noobs, players can make teams and play or join a game and the pairing system makes the game very fair.  Few imbalances, so not enogh to report and certainly didnt take from a fun time.Humor in the character dialogs, the annoucers, ect... GET THIS GAME! Its worth the tiny bit it costs and the graphics... are terrific for such a quick download and easy to learn game. If you like Team Fortress, you will love this!

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												A prettty good game let down by the dead multiplayer and shockingly bad settings. When I have to manually edit the config files to get a standard feature working on a fantastic engine, you're doing something wrong.FOV - Capped at 90. I changed it to 110 in the config, but I don't know if it did♥♥♥♥♥♥Resolution - Something that is settings 101, has preset resolutions so if you have a non-16:9, or even an obscure 16:9 you'll have to edit the configs here as well. What's worse is there are black bars along the top and bottom for me, even though the resolution is at 1440x900. Unreal Engine 3 easily supports different aspect ratios, so support them.Stuff like motion blur and vSync should NOT be enabled by default.If the devs fixed these problems and the multiplayer community came back, it'd be a pretty solid game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												I started off playing just for the TF2 awards, but I ended up really liking Super Monday Night Combat.Super MNC is a fast, fun, competitive, and often difficult third-person shooter where you play team-versus-team in a handful of game modes. In ways, it's very similar to Team Fortress 2 and DOTA 2. That might sound strange, but once you try a round or two and get a feel for the play, which involves lots of wacky characters escorting waves of robots to the enemy goal (while blasting the opposing team's robots yourself), you'll see what I mean. Through quirky humor and loads of character upgrades, Super MNC does manage to carve out its own place, however.I found Super MNC to be a bit hard to get into, and not just because other players seem to be godly at the game, but because the tutorial is confusing and doesn't really explain well how everything works. I suspect this is an area the developer had to skimp on, due to the game's odd (botched?) release, and subsequent issues. It's worth it to read up on things and put in some time though - the game is fun and rewarding once you figure everything out.It's a shame the game's maker, Uber Entertainment, has seemingly abandoned this game, as it's still fun to play, and there still seems to be enough people around to find a game to play at just about any time of day. The core game is free to play, however, and there's lots of fun to be had without having to buy in, so it's hard not to recommend Super MNC, even in it's somewhat neglected state.

												A nice take on the Moba style of game with the setting MNC offering a nice amount of humour, a 3rd person shooter with the standard creeps and towers of a moba. There is currently a lack of players so finding games can take a while and the skill difference between players can vary wildly because of this with a team of relativly new players being put against a player with alot more skill which can lead to some frustrating games where one player can win the game for a team. But in those few games where you get a good balance of teams the game play is enjoyable there is also a PvE mode called blitz (a fairly standard horde style mode) if waiting for a PvP game takes too long or if PvP isn't your thing. It's a free to play game that's worth a look if you're stuck for new games to play

Posted: January 26, 2015
												The game is fun with it's overall mecanics and gameplay, with a twist on the MOBA genre and a break on other MOBA games(DOTA, LOL, ECT...) and the all too serious, comepletly rage on you or your teamates for one non-game changing mistake teamates. (Literatly it's a rage fest filled with those who the follow the rank-and-file of the game or in better terms "The Meta" and and assualt all who don't follow it, reminds me of a cult in many terms than one.) This is a fun, fast paced game that takes a bit more skill than you think since you ACTIVELY control your character, not a point and click simulator. Overall, this game is on the lighter side of things and even though it has a smaller roster than other MOBA games and some bugs(I'm looking at you treasure ball system, even though it's not a bad bug.) It's an above average game. I recommend this to anyone who want a twist from the norm(There should be more of there type of games.) and to just relax from the serious of it all. 7/10P.S: And becides, I really doubt there's 603 players online and only around 10 maybe 20 players in the global chat.

It would seem that the Hotshots have activated the Steam Review, Chip!Super Monday Night Combat is a mixture of Dota 2, SMITE, TF2 and Brawl Busters and like Brawl Busters, this game is nearly dead. Infact i think it's UNDEAD at this point. Anyway, You have multiple characters to play as such as an alternate version of The Ultimate Warrior, a Fanboy who went full on Yandere-Psychopath and is one of the most pain in the♥♥♥♥♥characters to deal with, Mario with a Medigun and a shotgun (You can even get a TF2 Medipack!), Donkey Kong in a suit, Leonardo Da Vinci, Combat Girl who is best girl out of the Pit Girls and the list goes on for another 12 more characters. With a whopping TWENTY-FIVE PLAYERS i am amazed that this game's online servers are still up. If you ever want to be the 26th, then try this game out for a spin. Play enough and you will even be rewarded with TF2 Hats. Oh and don't forget...THE RULES HAVE CHANGED.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 10, 2012
												This game is fantastic, but there is a wicked learning curve, as with any MOBA.That's right, this game is a MOBA. If you are coming for a shooter (e.g. "I just want the TF2 hats!") you will be disappointed. Oh, there is shooting. Lots of shooting. It's just that your shooting skills won't be nearly as important as your sense of teamwork and map awareness.The blance between characters is pretty good, although certain characters will feel OP or UP until you learn to play against them or as them, respectively.Also, the content in this game can be purchased through microtransactions, but all the core gameplay elements can be achieved for FREE within a reasonable time frame through playing games with a rotating free character roster. If you are familiar with League of Legends, the store is basically exactly like that.Ultimately, a very fun and rewarding game, if you stick with it. Don't play for just the TF2 hats, people will hate you.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2013
												This game is one of the most poorly balanced, steaming piles of crap I have ever played. The main reason is the stupid ♥♥♥♥ing grapple mechanic. With certain weapons and when in range, you can press the right mouse button which locks players into an animation AND does about 1/3 of their health bars worth of damage. It takes what should be a very smart blend of third-person shooting and tactical MOBA gameplay and flushes it down the toliet with such an easy to use method of getting kills.  MNC started with a good idea but diluated it with stuff put in to cater to casual noobs who like flashy animations. And if you really want a good third-person MOBA, check out Smite.

												I still recommend this game despite the fact that going F2P only hurt the experience. The original MNC was a fairly balanced game that suffered from a bad map or two, Super MNC has vastly improved maps and a stronger focus on supporting the bots versus attacking other players. While the shift of focus to the bots is great and how the original game was intended to play out sadly it ends up not making a difference with the pay to win classes and endorsements/perks. The fact the the more unbalanced a character is the more they cost shows that this is by design. It is still fun to play but your game might be cut short by someone that just bought their way to your money ball.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												Despite the fact that I'm initially not recommending this game. I must say that this game was perhaps among my favorites to play. To me it felt like an interesting experiment. It felt like a MOBA in terms of mechanic, but it felt like a third person shooter in terms of gameplay and it ultimatelly created quite a unique experience. I moved on to a game like Smite that also prides itself in being a '3rd person MOBA' -- But Smite feels too rooted in it's MOBA mechanics for the 3rd person camera to serve more purpose other than a small and sligtly unique niche. SMNC had a nice balance to it's MOBA mechanics and it's 3rd person gaming elements. The arena and stereotypically commercial commentary was also quite pleasing. Now for the bad things.. It had it's buggy issues at times and there were many complaints in terms of balance -- but I find a majority of that to be too nit-picky and if you actually participated in the forums; the devs might've listened to you. The problem with this game was opening itself to a new audience. It felt like it didn't attract much of the MOBA crowd, nor the gamers into third person shooting. Hence I felt like it wasn't advertise well and despite some support from a small, but dedicated fanbase.. well.. the game hasn't been updated since the dawn of the planet of the apes. This game has been abandoned. The devs have abandon it and so there's not much purpose to play a dead game. tl;dr: Fun game with much potential, but was unfortunetly left to crash and burn.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 7, 2013
												An intereting take on the MOBA genre, and free to play at that. A third person shooter where you level up and improve, all in the theme of a futuristic bloodsport viewed in a humorously casual manner like a modern-day football match. Your experience points are your prize money, you defend your money ball and attack the opponent's ball, and your customization is in the form of product placement and endorsements. (Need to bounce back fast? Try all-new Regenetol!)  I'd recommend it if you like shooters and MOBA games, but remember, FPS fans, this is a MOBA game. Don't be a lone wolf. You will die. A lot.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												Despite the fact that I'm initially not recommending this game. I must say that this game was perhaps among my favorites to play. To me it felt like an interesting experiment. It felt like a MOBA in terms of mechanic, but it felt like a third person shooter in terms of gameplay and it ultimatelly created quite a unique experience. I moved on to a game like Smite that also prides itself in being a '3rd person MOBA' -- But Smite feels too rooted in it's MOBA mechanics for the 3rd person camera to serve more purpose other than a small and sligtly unique niche. SMNC had a nice balance to it's MOBA mechanics and it's 3rd person gaming elements. The arena and stereotypically commercial commentary was also quite pleasing. Now for the bad things.. It had it's buggy issues at times and there were many complaints in terms of balance -- but I find a majority of that to be too nit-picky and if you actually participated in the forums; the devs might've listened to you. The problem with this game was opening itself to a new audience. It felt like it didn't attract much of the MOBA crowd, nor the gamers into third person shooting. Hence I felt like it wasn't advertise well and despite some support from a small, but dedicated fanbase.. well.. the game hasn't been updated since the dawn of the planet of the apes. This game has been abandoned. The devs have abandon it and so there's not much purpose to play a dead game. tl;dr: Fun game with much potential, but was unfortunetly left to crash and burn.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2012
												I recently wrote a recommendation to this game giving it praise for its balance, and improved combat. I deleted it and laughed at myself for trying to play the sequel to this game. Just as broken as the first one, and even worse now. I take pretty much everything back I had said nice about this game, it is NOT worth playing anymore. The team matchmake has to be the worst ever created in a game; your defeats will break down your will to continue to play. Go ahead and play if you REALLY want to. Just know what's coming. I honestly think you'd be better off getting the hats for tf2 and then leaving before the seemingly addictive combat draws you in too deep, and then at the end you realize it was all for nothing. I won't be reinstalling this, and only if they release some new balances (which isn't likely, they never are) or a new class, I wouldn't be playing again. I hate to say it, but it just isn't worth it.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2012
												Remember the original Monday Night Combat? Well now think of it but with way more playable characters. Remember how people talk about there being a 10th class in TF2? Well this game has gone 10th class and BEYOND!That's what Super MNC is. Lead your robots to the enemy Moneyball as your old favourites such as the super-optimistic Assault or the silent and sneaky Assassin, or as one of the new and unexpected faces of the competition such as the hulking Veteran, the over-the-top gorilla actor Cheston, the cute yet tough rollerskating Megabeth, the living boombox Robohobo, the loony and twisted Wascot, or Leonardo Da Vinci himself!Also, enjoy full-colour commentary and the hilarious antics of SMNC's new announcers: The constantly divorced GG Stack and retired MNC veteran Chip Valvano.The Rules Have Changed, but the action stays the same. It's Monday night, the bacon and churros are still delicious, and the Pros are ready!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												I started off playing just for the TF2 awards, but I ended up really liking Super Monday Night Combat.Super MNC is a fast, fun, competitive, and often difficult third-person shooter where you play team-versus-team in a handful of game modes. In ways, it's very similar to Team Fortress 2 and DOTA 2. That might sound strange, but once you try a round or two and get a feel for the play, which involves lots of wacky characters escorting waves of robots to the enemy goal (while blasting the opposing team's robots yourself), you'll see what I mean. Through quirky humor and loads of character upgrades, Super MNC does manage to carve out its own place, however.I found Super MNC to be a bit hard to get into, and not just because other players seem to be godly at the game, but because the tutorial is confusing and doesn't really explain well how everything works. I suspect this is an area the developer had to skimp on, due to the game's odd (botched?) release, and subsequent issues. It's worth it to read up on things and put in some time though - the game is fun and rewarding once you figure everything out.It's a shame the game's maker, Uber Entertainment, has seemingly abandoned this game, as it's still fun to play, and there still seems to be enough people around to find a game to play at just about any time of day. The core game is free to play, however, and there's lots of fun to be had without having to buy in, so it's hard not to recommend Super MNC, even in it's somewhat neglected state.

content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												Pro: Fun combination of MOBA and shooter-action. It's fun deciding between spawning more bots/turrets or boosting yourself with cash. All characters are pretty unique in playstyle. Personally, I really like the style of the art and commentary (a little more serious than TF2, but less "in your face" than the borderlands games).Con: player-base is really small, you need to be in the chat to actually get games started. Most of the player-base is really experienced veterans or newbies after TF2 hats, so learning the game is rough. Cash shop seems to be mainly incredibly overpriced cosmetics and small character buffs.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 15, 2012
												Like LoL, DOTA, HoN or any other type of moba? So do I. But friends, tell me, are you not sometimes frustrated by the lack of direct control over your character? Are you not tired of merely throwing bright lights at your enemy? Sometimes, don't you just want to run up to the enemy, smash your shotgun into his face and crush his ribs with your knee as he bends over in anguish? Now, imagine doing all that as a 400lb gorilla trained in the theatrical arts in the finest shakespearean traditions.Super MNC. All the strategy and teamplay of DOTA style games at a higher skill level. And with the best in-game commentary you will ever hear. Play it, enjoy it, and know that if we ever meet on the fields of MNC as enemies I will kill you swiftly, but not painlessly. Because my airstrike sets you on fire. Sorry about that .

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 25, 2014
												Don't get me wrong, this game is great for what I've played: a MOBA with Third-person shooter elements and a great amount of fun. But there's two big problems with it:1- The community is very small. For a PvP game where skill makes a huge difference, this is terrible. Most of the players are experienced and will wipe the floor with you. This would not be too much of a problem if the matchmaking was okay...2- ... which it isn't. From what I've seen, matchmaking is entirely random. You could get a team full of newcomers and fight against a group of veterans who will murder you. You might get lucky, sure. But if you also team up with friends, you'll get tossed against some of the most experienced players in the world. The matchmaking is ludicrous in any situation and makes you rely greatly on luck until you get some skill.If Uber entertainment wasn't leaving this game for dead (look at their updating history), it would have the potential to be awesome. The classes are very cool, there are a lot of interesting elements that other MOBAs have not, and the atmosphere of being in a stadium doing some futuristic sport with laser weapons is amazing.
